entries.definition: Reverse-DNS stable identifier for a pack. Identity is immutable and never reused.
Semver for pack content. Major bumps denote breaking changes; meaning never shifts.
Integer manifest format version that defines parsing and required keys.
Engine version range required to load the pack; refusal if unmet.
Declared capabilities provided by this pack.
Capabilities required by this pack; never pack IDs or file paths.
Opaque extension map that must be preserved across loads and saves.
An auditable, namespaced permission to perform an action or access an interface.
Authority gates actions only; it never gates visibility.
A refusal code is a stable integer and token that explains why an action was refused.
Chunk type identifies the semantic payload of a save/replay chunk.
Process IO meaning is the semantic contract of inputs and outputs.
Identifiers once released must never be reused with new meaning.
Old data cannot be reinterpreted without explicit versioned transform or refusal.
